TopicTitle: [1.4.3]ALCOR,"Advanced Landing Capsule for Orbital Rendezvous" by ASET (08/02/2017)

Articles.Content:
*pokepokes* I'm serious about this robot arm control plugin thing.

I can't really do it myself because whatever I write would need direct access to InfernalRobotics classes. Which doesn't quite work in KSP because of things I have explained peviously -- it needs to be in the same assembly or you have to muck about with reflection. There's even a feature to pass menu control buttons to plugins in version 0.7, which I'm releasing as soon as alexustas says it's definitely not broken.

Crap I thought I sent you a PM about it. I'm definitely on board for doing that! I'm just taking a super short hiatus from coding to do some texturing (modelling is done) for the Dynasoar. There's a few things I want to update for the plugin that is GUI related and this will be a nice addition. kOS has support for interplugin communication but I've hit a small snag on robotic groups but it works nicely.

Crap I thought I sent you a PM about it. I'm definitely on board for doing that!

Woot! I'll make sure to poke you about it when you post anything about your Dynasoar then.
Looks awesome! Would prefer it slightly smaller as a 2 man though, makes it more LEMy

Looks awesome! Would prefer it slightly smaller as a 2 man though, makes it more LEMy

Well then just put two kerbals onto it

My operational 2-stage Alcor LEM. Note the LRV in the background.

The ascent stage.

Mod List and .craft file?
MFD in action )
oh god i think my jaw just fell off and left a crater and also AWESOME
This is by far my favorite pod , cant wait for the new upgrades to it !

MFD in action )

What is that contact light for? Could it be Remote tech integration?

question...

would it be possible to add like an adapter for the ALCOR so that it would fit better if used as a station part?
It's a ground contact light. The Apollo lander had those prongs on the landing legs... this is a simulation of them.

It's a ground contact light. The Apollo lander had those prongs on the landing legs... this is a simulation of them.

Oh Thanks! When I saw those pictures my jaw broke the keyboard tray! Can't wait for the update!
It just keeps getting better. Fantastic work.... Hat is off to you...

Just a question:

could both of you imagine to make a command pod after you finished this one?

This if by far the best and advanced IVA i've seen in this game. This shouldn't just be in a lander.

I also love it's style.

greetings,

Themorris
Agreed... IVA's like this for the pod's.... Oh man.....

Random note: This capsule is not automatically recognized by IonCross Crew Support. I'll go in and manually edit the .cfgs to add o2/co2 resources but it might be worth it to look into how to get this pod to be automatically seen by IonCross and TAC (for those of us who use such things).
Do they actually do anything to recognise capsules automatically in the first place?

What is that contact light for? Could it be Remote tech integration?

contact with the surface of a body, its even blue like in the apollo lunar module
Have those Fancy IVAs Been released yet?

Have those Fancy IVAs Been released yet?

Have you actually downloaded the package in the OP?

could both of you imagine to make a command pod after you finished this one?
Agreed... IVA's like this for the pod's.... Oh man.....

We'll see. Meanwhile, since I wasn't asked to keep it secret, I'll say that I've just helped BobCat debug a configuration problem on a new pod. The ball component wasn't starting up correctly.

We'll see. Meanwhile, since I wasn't asked to keep it secret, I'll say that I've just helped BobCat debug a configuration problem on a new pod. The ball component wasn't starting up correctly.

It can't be! You mean that that pod gets one too!?

It can't be! You mean that that pod gets one too!?

Well, I'm sure he's sticking with the displays, because he made new models for them and asked me if they can be safely animated. (They can.) I have no idea whether he ends up using the ball component or not, or whether he will use any of the other widgets in my plugin.

Well, I'm sure he's sticking with the displays, because he made new models for them and asked me if they can be safely animated. (They can.) I have no idea whether he ends up using the ball component or not, or whether he will use any of the other widgets in my plugin.

Still amazing!
